title.narrative: QUALITY AND INCLUSIVE LEARNING - PRIMARY

description.narrative: Government authorities have strengthened capacity to improve the system for quality, equitable and inclusive education, including the development of social and emotional skills (Basic Education), which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Sanitation, Skills Development, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have improved education and learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government authorities have strengthened capacity to improve the system for quality, equitable and inclusive education, including the development of social and emotional skills (Basic Education)

description.narrative: The capacity of basic education system to improve quality, equity and inclusion is constrained as shown in the 2018 Programme for International Student Assessment. The long-term Basic Education Master Plan was partially achieved with the drafted Education Sector Analysis produced. UNICEF support for evidence generation on learner performance, development of 21st century skills, longitudinal studies, Southeast Asia learning assessment and innovations for disadvantaged learners provide essential evidence-informed inputs for enhancing social-emotional learning, a critical element of quality education. Advocacy on equity and inclusion contributed to promoting child rights for education and ensuring healthy, safe and protective learning environments. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of children provided with teaching and learning materials to support home study in short term school closures with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available

target.value: 2021:Localization of Basic Educaction Sector Plan in Regional and Division Devt Plans initiated

actual.value: 2019:On-going DepEd core planning team trained on Simulation Model development by UNESCO Bangkok, mentored on problem tree analysis, supported on conduct of consultations to validate problem analysis, and supported data analysis and drafting of the Education Sector Analysis. title.narrative: WinS standards have been integrated into DepED DRRM and EiE guidelines

actual.value: 2019:Selected WinS provisions included in School Safety and Preparedness Guide and School DRRM Monitoring Tool, but no draft of a comprehensive guidelines on WinS DRR yet.

title.narrative: Existence of Policy Framework on strengthening quality social and emotional learning in education system

actual.value:
2019:ompleted The curriculum audit for 21st century skills in 2 subjects and 3 grade levels have been completed within the agreed timelines. Research dissemination conducted. The final report and roadmap for strategic directions and recommendations were completed.
